task_summary: Detect the pot lid, approach from above, grasp the lid handle, then lift the lid upward and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator must lift the metal lid off a small pot placed on a box atop a table. The contact sheet shows the arm moving in from the right, aligning above the lidâ€™s handle, descending to make contact, closing the gripper, and lifting the lid upward. The behavior tree prioritizes reliable perception, precise alignment, gentle grasping, and a vertical lift to avoid collisions with the pot rim or nearby objects.
preconditions: Robot has free workspace around pot
Lid handle is graspable from top
stepwise_plan: Verify or actively scan until the lid is visible.
Move above the lid and open the gripper.
Compute a top grasp on the lid handle and align precisely.
Lower until contact and pick using the computed grasp.
Lift vertically and retreat from the pot area.
success_criteria: Lid is securely held by the gripper
Lid is lifted clear of the pot without collision
Robot retreats to a safe offset
failure_and_recovery: If lid not visible: scan with an arc pattern and retry up to 3 times.
If alignment fails: re-approach using the same computed grasp pose.
If grasp slips: reopen, recompute grasp, and retry pick.
If contact not detected: lower again within safe depth.
task_long_description.termination: End when the lid is lifted above the pot and the robot has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: Approach alignment over the lid handle is clearly visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Descent and grasp are expected immediately after alignment.

task_instruction: lift up a lid from the pot

node_specs.description: Checks if the lid is currently visible.
Active scan to find the lid if not visible.
Position above the lid for top approach.
Compute a top grasp on the lid handle.
Align tool to the computed grasp pose.
Descend gently until contact is detected.
Close gripper to pick the lid.
Checks if the grasp is stable before lifting.
Back off to a safe distance with the lid held.

failure_modes: Lid not detected due to glare or occlusion
Misalignment causes gripper to miss handle
Insufficient grip force leads to slip
Collision with pot rim during lift
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning via arc pattern (up to 3 attempts)
Re-align using ApproachAndAlign and recompute grasp if needed
Reopen gripper and repeat LowerUntilContact then Pick
Abort lift and retreat if unexpected contact spikes
assumptions: Frames depict a pot with a graspable lid handle; instruction matches visuals.
Workspace around pot remains static; vertical lift clears nearby obstacles.
Top grasp on lid handle is feasible; suction not required.

expected_success_criteria: Lid visibly clears pot by a safe vertical margin
No contact with pot rim during lift
Robot ends in retreat pose holding lid
